required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: TTUHSC El Paso Public Health Biorepository (Research Core Laboratories Dental Biorepository)

lead_sponsor.agency: Texas Tech University Health Sciences Center, El Paso

collaborator.agency: The City of El Paso Department of Public Health

clinical_study.source: Texas Tech University Health Sciences Center, El Paso

brief_summary.textblock: The prevalence of tooth decay and other oral disease are often overlooked indicators of overall public health. To improve the understanding of oral health in El Paso, the City of El Paso Health Department has teamed up with Texas Tech University Health Sciences Center El Paso in a collaborative effort to determine the factors that contribute to poor oral hygiene, and lead to cavities and periodontitis. The team will collect saliva, oral debris, leftover teeth and plaque from children and young adults to study oral infections, markers of inflammation, and other contributors to tooth decay and oral illnesses. Samples also will be stored for future investigations. This joint effort will provide a better picture of oral health in El Paso, and will define a framework for prevention, earlier diagnosis, and better treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Creation of tissue, blood and saliva Biorepository
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Tissue, blood and saliva will be collected from dental patients to be stored for research

primary_outcome.measure: The study of oral bacterial and viruses
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Samples will be analyzed to determine if bacteria and viruses play a role in oral health

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Samples will be tested for inflammatory markers

biospec_descr.textblock: Saliva and blood samples potentially with DNA will be stored

study_pop.textblock: Male and female patients between the ages of 12-21.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Uninsured, medicaid and Title V seen at the City of El Paso Dental Clinics ages 12-21
- Lean, overweight and obese male and female children and young adults living in El Paso County
- Healthy children and patients that are likely to be seen in the clinics within the predetermined follow-up time of 6 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under 12 years of age and over 21 years of age.
